quotes.quote: Arguments of convenience lack integrity and inevitably trip you up.
Memory has many conveniences, and, among others, that of foreseeing things as they have afterwards happened.
The idea behind fast food is great - people want convenience.
It is function of government to invent philosophies to explain the demands of its own convenience.
If it is solely an evolutionary convenience, there is really no such thing as good or evil.
Young people are just as attracted to the truth as they are convenience and expediency.
The vision is that people should have the ultimate in convenience. Being able to get the things they care about on the appropriate device.
Always remember that market quotations are there for convenience, either to be taken advantage of or to be ignored.
It is dainty to be sick if you have leisure and convenience for it.
Thought is so cunning, so clever, that it distorts everything for its own convenience.

The convenience of timekeeping is greatly overrated; and the people who practice it so faithfully that they lose the capacity for appreciating the fixed and the static and the spatially related experiences cut themselves off from a good part of reality.
The technologies of convenience are making our sphere of exploration and experience smaller.
A faith of convenience is a hollow faith.
The reason for having diplomatic relations is not to confer a compliment, but to secure a convenience. [On diplomatic recognition of the People's Republic of China]
No real surrender involves convenience.
We seek neither convenience nor ease, but to live at the edge of possibility.
Convenience is not an acceptable foundational value for society. It's a disease.
The marriage of convenience has this to recommend it: we are better judges of convenience than we are of love.
Our waking life's desire to shape the world to our convenience invites all manner of paradox and difficulty.
There is no reason that the universe should be designed for our convenience.
Habits and customs are a convenience devised for the support of timid natures who dare not allow their souls free play.

The success of family welfare depends on giving women complete freedom with their lives. The need of the hour is that people should plan their families as per their convenience and get the bare minimum health facilities.
Thank goodness modern convenience is a thing of the remote future.
The 'control of nature' is a phrase conceived in arrogance, born of the Neanderthal age of biology and philosophy, when it was supposed that nature exists for the convenience of man.
True piety for the universe but no time for religions made for man's convenience.
The world will always choose convenience over reality. It's easier to hate, blame, and fear than it is to understand. No one wants the truth; they want entertainment.
Sacrifice is a step beyond convenience.
To what fortuitous occurrence do we not owe every pleasure and convenience of our lives.
Each one writes history according to his convenience.
Let us agree that we are marrying so we can go on quarrelling in the greatest possible comfort and convenience.
Every convenience brings its own inconveniences along with it.
Speech is for the convenience of those who are hard of hearing; but there are many fine things which we cannot say if we have to shout.
Your work should be an act of love, not a marriage of convenience.
People today are too concerned about saving time and having convenience.
Unfortunately, the world has not been designed for the convenience of mathematicians.
